gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
The 'GISCO NUTS 2006' dataset represents the NUTS regions by means of region, arc and point topology. The NUTS geographical information is completed by attribute tables and a set of cartographic help lines to better visualise multipart polygonal regions.
The NUTS nomenclature is a hierarchical classification of statistical regions defined by Eurostat. The NUTS classification subdivides the EU economic territory into 3 statistical levels. The Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) was enforced the 11 July 2003. This regulation provided the NUTS classification with a legal background. Since then, 12 new countries joined the European Union. The NUTS regulation was officially enforced in these 12 countries the day of their accession to the EU. A non official NUTS-like classification has been defined for the EFTA countries, Croatia and Turkey. For further information about the NUTS classification please check the RAMON Eurostat site at http://ec.europa.eu/comm/eurostat/ramon/nuts/home_regions_en.html At present, six scale ranges (100K, 1M, 3M, 10M and 20M, 60M) are maintained in the GISCO geodatabase. The polygon and boundary classes delineate the regions while the points provide a label for each region. Associated tables contain basic information such as the region's name.
This feature class represents the polyline geometry of the 1:10.000.000 scale level of the NUTS boundaries.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Data on administrative boundaries represent a fundamental element of almost any GIS. In the context of the GISCO information system, the NUTS boundaries data are a vital part of the geographic framework, providing means for registering data to regional territories. Equally, national and regional boundaries are essential components of the cartographic backdrop giving a recognisable geographic context to cartographic outputs.

gmd:keyword.gco:CharacterString: Area Management/restriction/regulation zones and reporting units

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Directive 20007/.../EC/ of the European parliament and of the Council of establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This dataset has been created for cartographic purposes.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Source shall be acknowledged: "Source: GISCO - Eurostat (European Commission)"
Copyright shall be acknowledged: "Copyright: EuroGeographics for the administrative boundaries"

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Address to the point of contact specified in this metadata

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes should be present

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes are present

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) was checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing coded value domain tables were a test of domain consistency.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Errors will show during creation of integrity constraints in Oracle. Constraints will not be applicable in case of violations to the consistency.

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All the values of each coded value attribute are compliant to the domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of NUTS boundary features class at 10M

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_BN_10M_2006 boundaries must not have dangles, must not overlap, must not self-intersect, must not intersect or touch interior and must be singlepart

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: Some errors were identified but were inherited from the source or can be seen as exceptions.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency between NUTS regions and NUTS boundaries at 10M

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_BN_10M_2006 Must be covered by boundary of NUTS_RG_10M_2006

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: 6 topology errors identified but these are known exceptions. It concerns the country boundaries inside lakes.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_BN_10M_2006 Boundary must be covered by NUTS_BN_10M_2006 where CNTR participate in NUTS_2006

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All errors found were due to the unequal extent (cntr --> world and nuts --> EU27, EFTA, CC)

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString:
This dataset (together with the other datasets: COMM_2006, CNTR_2006 and COAS_2006) is based on geometry of EBM v2.0. of EuroGeographics on commune level with a resolution of 30m (scale 1:100.000) enriched with some other datasources like Gaul 2006 country data, Scole, NSI of TR, Digital Chart of the World and ArcWorld data. This resulted in a common repository of geometry of which the different datasets were derived. The different scale levels were derived of generalisations of the common repository on 100K scale. This means that within each scale level the feature classes of all these datasets: COMM_2006, NUTS_2006, CNTR_2006 and COAS_2006, are fully coherent and compliant. The NUTS_2006 dataset consists of 2 feature classes (regions labels and boundaries) per scale level (100k, 1M, 3M, 10M, 20M, 60M). The boundaries and regions are related to each other through a relationship table. The 5 small scale feature classes should be used exclusively for cartographic purposes. Apart from the 12 above mentioned feature classes there is also a label feature class (scale independent). This labelpoint feature class was created with a label inside each NUTS region at the 4 NUTS levels (0 - 3).
In addition two line feature classes were created: one feature class for cartograhic joiners to identify where NUTS areas have one or more enclaves and a second line feature class for cartographic separators, to identify where the NUTS limits are in the archipelagos. The arcs of two latter feature classes are only useful for cartographic purposes and are not meant to identify actual administrative or statistical boundaries stretching into the sea or any other significance. The extent of this feature class is EU27, EFTA and Croatia and Turkey.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString:
The sources used to create the Common repository for the 100K scale level are:
(i) Eurogeographics EBM v2.0. and SCOLE data (scale 1:100K) (ii) GAUL 2006 country level data (iii) NSI of TR for the Turkish features (iv) Digital Chart of the World (Kaliningrad) (v) ArcWorld Data (Aral Sea, Kaspian Sea, some other borders) (vi) GRO (General Register Office for Scotland) -- for scale level 100K (vii) NUTS nomenclature supplied by EUROSTAT -- for all scale levels
This feature class is created from a generalization of this common repository

gmd:definition.gco:CharacterString: NUTS boundaries 1:10.000.000 version 2006, Polyline feature class table
NUTS Boundary Identifier (Boundary ID for relation to Regions)

Statistical Level Code Indication of type of boundary according to the statistical level of the regions separated by the boundary 0: National boundary (highest level in the hierarchy) 1: Level 1 boundary 2: Level 2 boundary 3: Level 3 boundary 9: Not applicable

Boundary Flag for Countries of the European Union Defines whether the boundary delimits a country or region of the European Union or not F: False, the boundary does not delimit any EU region T: True, at least one side of the boundary delimits an EU region

Boundary Flag for EFTA Countries Defines whether the boundary delimits a EFTA country or region or not F: False, the boundary does not delimit any EFTA region T: True, at least one side of the boundary delimits an EFTA region

Boundary Flag for Candidate Countries Defines whether the boundary delimits a Candidate Country or region in a Candidate Country or not F: False, the boundary does not delimit any region in a Candidate Country T: True, at least one side of the boundary delimits a region in a Candidate Country

Boundary Flag for Other Countries Defines whether the boundary delimits an Other Country or region in an Other Country or not (other than EU, EFTA or candidate country) F: False, the boundary does not delimit any region in an Other Country T: True, at least one side of the boundary delimits a region in an Other Country
Coastal flag. Defines whether a boundary is a coastline or not. F: FALSE, the boundary represents no coastline T: TRUE, the boundary represents a coastline

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS)
